choices.answer: Working in a remote location with no coverage;
Being deployed by the defence force.

questions.question: When wouldn't a customer want to temporarily suspend a service?
Mobile and Fixed customers can temporarily suspend their services.
If a customer is on a fixed term contract, how many times can they suspend their service, and for how long?

choices.answer: Maximum of 2 times and up to 365 days at a time.
As many times as they like & up to 90 days at a time.
Once for the remaining length of their contract.
Maximum of 3 times and up to 90 days at a time.

questions.question: If a service has a data restriction on it you are still able to make and receive calls.

choices.answer: To reduce the minimum monthly cost.
To reduce the cost while being deployed by the Defence force.
Customers might want to prevent particular types of calls.
As travelling for a few months overseas and want to reduce costs.

questions.question: Why might a customer want to restrict their service?
The same rules around suspending the service applies for all Optus customers.
How long can a defence force customer suspend a service for?
How much is the monthly voluntary suspension fee per month?

choices.answer: That the contract will be extended by the time the service is suspended.
Any insurance costs will continue to be charged.
Any Handset charges will continue to be billed.

questions.question: What is not important to mention to all contracted customers?

choices.answer: Incoming calls from a particular number

questions.question: What product can not be restricted in Jarvis.
